elements.name: Accessibility basics
elements.summary: Keyboard nav, labels, contrast, focus.

elements.name: Destructive ops audit coverage
elements.summary: Evidence that irreversible actions emit complete audit events (who/what/when/why).

elements.name: Audit log integrity
elements.summary: Append-only events + verification hooks.

elements.name: Agent access receipts
elements.summary: Receipts proving agent access was granted (e.g., payment proof, capability token, or signed allowance).

elements.name: DID document
elements.summary: DID document or equivalent registry binding used for portable identity anchoring.

elements.name: Login receipts
elements.summary: Evidence of successful login events (non-sensitive) suitable for auditing and troubleshooting.

elements.name: Session audit log
elements.summary: Append-only audit record of session creation/refresh/revocation.

elements.name: Backup policy
elements.summary: Regular backups + restore drills.

elements.name: Migration plan
elements.summary: Plan for schema changes + rollback.

elements.name: Change control record
elements.summary: Evidence of change request, review, approval, and rollout (e.g., ticket + audit log).

elements.name: Separation-of-duties controls
elements.summary: Evidence of role separation controls, reviewer/approver independence, and periodic access reviews.

elements.name: Traceability matrix
elements.summary: Mapping from requirements to implementation artifacts and verification evidence.

elements.name: Relational constraints evidence
elements.summary: Evidence of NOT NULL/UNIQUE/FK constraints and invariants enforced at the DB layer.

elements.name: Schema versioning
elements.summary: Explicit schema versions for artifacts.

elements.name: Lockfile discipline
elements.summary: Lockfile committed; no floating deps.

elements.name: Consistency model declaration
elements.summary: Declared consistency and ordering semantics (strong/eventual, monotonic reads, etc.).

elements.name: Fault injection tests
elements.summary: Evidence of fault injection/chaos tests across failure modes (network, node, disk).

elements.name: Partition behavior matrix
elements.summary: Documented behavior under partitions and degraded modes (read-only, reject writes, etc.).

elements.name: Webhook deduplication evidence
elements.summary: Evidence of receiver-side dedupe using event IDs + storage (prevents duplicate processing).

elements.name: Webhook replay protection evidence
elements.summary: Evidence of replay protection (timestamp window tests).

elements.name: Webhook signature verification evidence
elements.summary: Evidence of signature verification (tests, fixtures, docs).

elements.name: Boundary tests
elements.summary: Evidence that sandbox boundaries are enforced and tested.

elements.name: Deterministic build evidence
elements.summary: Evidence of reproducible builds/toolchain determinism for runtime artifacts.

elements.name: Isolation tests
elements.summary: Evidence that isolation boundaries are enforced under attack/escape attempts.

elements.name: Threat boundary spec
elements.summary: Declared threat boundary and trust assumptions for the sandbox/runtime.

elements.name: Interface specification
elements.summary: An explicit boundary contract: OpenAPI/AsyncAPI/JSON Schema or equivalent, versioned.

elements.name: SLO contract
elements.summary: Published latency/availability/error-budget expectations for a boundary.

elements.name: Boundary version bump evidence
elements.summary: Evidence that a breaking boundary change triggers a contract version bump (e.g., tagged spec, changelog, migration note, or release pipeline check).

elements.name: Drift monitoring evidence
elements.summary: Evidence of active drift monitoring (dashboard, alerts, thresholds, and response playbook).

elements.name: Model registry record
elements.summary: Evidence of a registered model version with metadata (metrics, dataset hash/ID, owner, stage).

elements.name: Reproducibility linkage
elements.summary: Evidence linking model training inputs/outputs to proof-lane receipts (commit, build, artifact hashes).

elements.name: Errors signal
elements.summary: Track error rate and failure modes.

elements.name: Latency signal
elements.summary: Track tail latency (p95/p99).

elements.name: Saturation signal
elements.summary: Track resource saturation (CPU, mem, queue).

elements.name: Traffic signal
elements.summary: Track request rate/throughput.

elements.name: Runbooks
elements.summary: Human-readable runbooks for critical ops.

elements.name: Performance budget
elements.summary: Budget for JS size, TTFB, LCP.

elements.name: Non-custodial default
elements.summary: Integrations opt-in; no hidden custody.

elements.name: Replay protection evidence
elements.summary: Evidence of nonce/timestamp window enforcement and replay rejection tests for proof presentations.

elements.name: Verification spec
elements.summary: Evidence that verification rules and disclosure boundaries are specified (what is proven, what is revealed, and acceptance criteria).

elements.name: Verification tests
elements.summary: Compatibility tests demonstrating verifiers can validate presentations per the spec across versions.

elements.name: Reproducible build evidence
elements.summary: Document how to reproduce builds deterministically (pinned deps, environment, and hashable outputs).

elements.name: Proof Lane contract
elements.summary: Node 24.x + reachable npm registry required for authority.

elements.name: Deterministic receipts
elements.summary: Timestamped receipts: cmd, exit_code, env.

elements.name: Receipts: SHA-256 + bytes
elements.summary: Artifacts are accompanied by byte size and SHA-256 hashes to enable independent verification.

elements.name: Hazard analysis
elements.summary: Hazard analysis / risk assessment artifact covering failure modes and mitigations.

elements.name: Requirements traceability matrix
elements.summary: Traceability mapping from requirements to design/implementation/tests/evidence.

elements.name: Validation report
elements.summary: Validation results showing the system meets intended use under defined conditions.

elements.name: Verification plan
elements.summary: Plan describing verification methods, acceptance criteria, and coverage expectations.

elements.name: SLO definition
elements.summary: Explicit SLOs tied to golden signals.
Proof that idempotency keys are generated, stored, and used for deduplication across retries.
elements.name: Idempotency key evidence
Latency budget
elements.summary: Declared end-to-end latency budget for deadlines.

elements.name: Latency/jitter budget
elements.summary: Declared latency and jitter budget aligned to deadlines.

elements.name: Priority inversion tests
elements.summary: Evidence that priority inversion scenarios are detected/mitigated.

elements.name: Scheduling evidence
elements.summary: Evidence that the scheduling strategy meets deadlines under load.

elements.name: WCET analysis evidence
elements.summary: Worst-case execution time analysis or measurement evidence.

elements.name: Secrets never persisted client-side
elements.summary: No client-side persistence of secrets; use env + kits.

elements.name: Desync tests
elements.summary: Evidence of desync detection under network perturbations.

elements.name: Net jitter tests
elements.summary: Evidence of simulation correctness under jitter/packet loss.

elements.name: Netcode evidence
elements.summary: Evidence for desync handling, rollback/resync or authoritative correction behavior.

elements.name: Replay determinism tests
elements.summary: Evidence that simulation replays reproduce identical state evolution.

elements.name: Replay tests
elements.summary: Deterministic replay evidence: same input stream yields same state trace.

elements.name: E2E tests
elements.summary: User-critical flows tested end-to-end.

elements.name: Integration tests
elements.summary: Boundary tests for kits/integrations.

elements.name: Unit tests
elements.summary: Deterministic unit tests for core logic.
